icontrol.drivers

Class GPIB_Prologix

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.GPIB_Driver
      • icontrol.drivers.GPIB_Prologix

  • public class GPIB_Prologix
extends GPIB_Driver
    This class provides access to the native code to access the Prologix's GPIB-USB.

    It uses Java Native Access (JNA) package to access the driver (for instance ftd2xx.dylib on Mac operating systems).

    Before being able to send and receive the method Open must be called, or else the behavior is undefined.

    Usage / How this class works:

    • Instantiate the class. The constructor calls LoadNative.
    • LoadNative establish access to the native code (for instance ftdi2xx.dylib on Mac OS), and then calls OpenFTDI. If the native library has been loaded before, this method does nothing but return.
    • OpenFTDI establishes the connection to the FTDI chip inside the Prologix controller before calling InitPrologix.
    • InitPrologix initializes the Prologix GPIB-USB controller; that is it sets parameters like the End-Of-Transmission mode or the GPIB Time-Out.
    • Open an Instrument at a specific GPIB address using Open, which stores the GPIB address and sends a Selected-Device-Clear to the Instrument at the specified GPIB address.
    • To send/receive data use SendCommand and Receive.
    • To close the connection to an Instrument call CloseInstrument.
    • Once done with all GPIB communication, close the connection to the GPIB controller with CloseController.
    • To receive the Status Byte - especially of older equipment that is not 488.2 compliant but implements 488 only, hence, no *STB? command - ReadStatusByte can be used.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

      • RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE

        private final int RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE
        size of the Receive buffer

      • TIMEOUT_USB

        private final int TIMEOUT_USB
        USB Time-Out value The FT_Read method reads a certain number of bytes or until a USB TimeOut occurs. Because ReadFromPrologix does not know in advance how many bytes to read, it is necessary so set a proper USB TimeOut value. Larger numbers slow down communication, and smaller numbers might lead to communication errors.

        See the additional comments at SpeedTest in the GPIB_Driver class.

      • TIMEOUT_GPIB

        private final int TIMEOUT_GPIB
        GPIB Time-Out value

      • DEBUG_PROLOGIX_RW_DELAY

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • GPIB_Prologix

        protected GPIB_Prologix()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor.

        It calls LoadNative to load the native library, which in turn calls OpenFDTI to establish and initialize connection to the FTDI chip inside the Prologix GPIB-USB controller. OpenFTDI then calls InitPrologix to initialize parameters in the Prologix controller.

        If the native library has already been loaded, LoadNativ returns without starting the cascade of initializations.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When 1) loading the native library failed (bubbles up from LoadNative), or 2) the connection to the FTDI chip could not be established (bubbles up from OpenFTDI), or 3) when the Prologix controller could not be initialized (bubbles up from OpenPrologix).

    • Method Detail

      • checkCommunicationError

        private void checkCommunicationError(java.lang.String Msg)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Checks the Status of the last communication with the FTDI chip in the Prologix GPIB-USB controller and throws an Exception if an error occurred. If an error occurred, this event is also Logged with level SEVERE. The member variable m_Status is used to determine if an error occurred.
        Parameters:
        Msg - This String is appended to the message thrown as an Exception when an error occurred.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an error occurred during the last GPIB operation

      • LoadNative

        private void LoadNative()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the native library if the library was not already loaded. In this case, it also calls OpenFTDI to establish a connection to the FTDI chip inside the Prologix controller. OpenFTDI also calls InitPrologix to initialize the Prologix controller.

        If the library has been loaded before this method returns without calling OpenFTDI.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If 1) the native library could not be loaded, or 2) the connection to the FTDI chip could not be established (bubbles up from OpenFTDI), or 3) when the Prologix controller could not be initialized (bubbles up from OpenPrologix).

      • OpenFTDI

        protected void OpenFTDI()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the FTDI device with the Product Description String specified in the iC.properties (which is a Prologix GPIB-USB controller). The ftHandle (m_ftPrologix) to address the Prologix controller is assigned here. After opening, the send and receive buffers are purged, the TimeOut value for communication with the FTDI chip over the USB bus is set (this is different from the GPIB TimeOut value), and the controller is initialized by calling InitPrologix.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When 1) the Device Info List could not be created, or 2) no FTDI devices were found to be attached to the USB bus, or 3) the controller could not be opened from the Product Description, or 4) the transmit and receive buffers in the FTDI chip could not be purged, or 5) setting the USB-TimeOut value failed, or 5) if the controller could not be initialized (bubbles up from InitPrologix).

      • InitPrologix

        private void InitPrologix()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the Prologx GPIB-USB controller. It sets parameters for:
        ++auto, ++eoi, ++eos, ++eot_enable, ++eot_char, ++mode, ++ifc, ++read_tmo_ms
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When communicating with the FTDI chip in the Prologix controller failed.

      • CloseController

        protected void CloseController()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the connection to the GPIB controller. This method is called from Dispatcher.run after the Script has been processed.

        This method switches the Prologix GPIB-USB controller in a device mode (rather than a controller mode) and addresses it to listen to GPIB address specified in the iC.properties. This allows multiple GPIB controllers to be connected at the same time.

        Specified by:
        CloseController in class GPIB_Driver
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the closing caused a GPIB error

      • getLibraryVersion

        private int getLibraryVersion()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the library version of the native FTD2xx driver. Only Windows operating Systems are supported. The response on MacOS is close to 65538.
        Returns:
        The library version of the FTD2xx native driver
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurred upon invoking the native code

      • Open

        protected void Open(int GPIB_Address)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the connection to the Instrument at the specified GPIB address.

        Because there are no special requirements to open an instrument, only a Selected Device Clear is sent.

        Specified by:
        Open in class GPIB_Driver
        Parameters:
        GPIB_Address - The primary GPIB address of the Instrument
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a GPIB transaction caused a GPIB error (bubbles up from checkErrorGPIB.

      • waitForEmptyTxQueue

        private void waitForEmptyTxQueue()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Checks if the Transmit-Queue of the FTDI chip in the Prologix controller is empty. If it is not empty, this method waits a bit and tries again for a certain number of times. This method was used during development and it should not be necessary to use it again.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - hmm ...

      • WriteToPrologix

        private int WriteToPrologix(java.lang.String Msg)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the given String to the Prologix GPIB-USB controller. The String should end with \r\n or without special termination, in which case \r\n is appended automatically. The \r\n is requested by the Prologix controller.
        Parameters:
        Msg - The data to be sent
        Returns:
        The number of bytes that have been sent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the transmission caused an error

      • Send

        protected long Send(java.lang.String Msg)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the given String via the GPIB bus to the Instrument specified in Open and returns the number of bytes actually sent. If Msg is empty, the method returns immediately.

        Specified by:
        Send in class GPIB_Driver
        Parameters:
        Msg - Data to be sent
        Returns:
        Number of data bytes actually sent.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the transmission caused a GPIB error

      • getGPIBStatus

        protected java.lang.String getGPIBStatus()
        Gets the Status of the last GPIB call. After each GPIB call, the error flag in the Status Byte should, ideally, be checked. If an error occurred, this method returns a String with a short description of what went wrong. If an error occurred, it should be logged to the Comm Logger.
        Specified by:
        getGPIBStatus in class GPIB_Driver
        Returns:
        When an error occurred during the last GPIB call, the returned String contains a somewhat helpful explanation of what went wrong. An empty String is returned if no error occurred.

      • ReadFromPrologix

        private java.lang.String ReadFromPrologix()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Read data from the Prologix GPIB-USB controller.
        Returns:
        The data read from the controller. The String's length equals the number of bytes received from the Prologix controller.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the transmission caused an error or the Receive Buffer is too small.

      • Receive

        protected java.lang.String Receive(boolean Trim)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Receives data from the Instrument specified in Open. The number of Bytes that are requested from the Instrument are specified by RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE, which, in turn, is specified in the iC.property file. Currently this value is 150000 which has proven useful in my personal experience. Increase this value if an Instrument places more data in the output queue. A number which is too small will most likely result in an erroneous transmission (Receive does not check if all data bytes have been read).
        Specified by:
        Receive in class GPIB_Driver
        Parameters:
        Trim - If true, newline (\n) and carriage return (\r) characters are removed from the end of the returned String.
        Returns:
        The data bytes sent by the Instrument wrapped in a String.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the transmission caused a GPIB error

      • ReadStatusByte

        public int ReadStatusByte()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the Status Byte of the Instrument defined in Open by serially polling the Instrument. Open must have been called before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        ReadStatusByte in class GPIB_Driver
        Returns:
        The Status Byte of the Instrument.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the transmission caused a GPIB error or the received Status Byte could not be converted into an Integer value.

      • CloseInstrument

        protected void CloseInstrument()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the connection to the Instrument specified in Open. This method is called from Dispatcher.run after the Script has been processed.

        This method switches the Instrument to a local mode.

        Specified by:
        CloseInstrument in class GPIB_Driver
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the closing caused a GPIB error

      • SpeedTestV2

        protected void SpeedTestV2(int NrIterations)
        Used to test the speed of the GPIB controller. Enable the Speed Test in the Open method respectively issue the ScriptCommand SpeedTest NrIterations (no Auto GUI is specified for this Script Command).

        This is a special implementation of the general SpeedTest method in the GPIB_Driver class which communicates directly with the FTDI/Prologix chip without (re-)addressing the instrument. The time obtained here can be viewed as minimal achievable time, while the time obtained from SpeedTest might be slightly larger due to overhead that needs, in general, to be sent.
